availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Winfrey H. Walters (Johnson County, KY, farmer and private 65th KY Militia)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Calvin Walters. Married to Elizabeth Preston Walters in Johnson County on October 11, 1854. Father of Levina Walters, James P. Walters, John M. Walters, and Shadrach Walters. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment Kentucky Enrolled Militia (U.S.A.) as a private from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 110A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 221.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 159B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film #994027-994058: Johnson County Marriages, 1852-1914, p. 3 of 25 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 895.
Find A Grave, “Winfrey Holbrook Walters (1833-1914)," Memorial #41274718, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41274718/winfrey-holbrook-walters (accessed August 18, 2020).
